image.altText: Kitchen bench top

props.synopsis: Australia's workplace ministers have agreed to implement a national ban on engineered stone, over concerns its use has led to a surge in silicosis cases among workers.

title.children: Engineered stone will be banned in Australia in world-first decision

image.altText: An aerial view of a coastal Australian city

props.synopsis: Residents of Perth's northern beaches are "on cloud nine" over the rejection of a controversial plan to build 17 groynes along the coast.

title.children: Residents 'on cloud nine' following Perth council backflip on controversial groyne plan

image.altText: A man sitting in a hotel room wearing an off-white hoodie

props.synopsis: Usman Khawaja says he will not wear shoes bearing the words "all lives are equal" during the Perth Test against Pakistan, but he says he will fight the ICC's ruling on the shoes.

title.children: 'My heart can't take it': Emotional Khawaja won't wear 'political' shoes, but will fight ICC ruling

image.altText: A family in a carport.

props.synopsis: The Department of Communities says it never had any intention of evicting 74-year-old Melba Munmurrie from public housing in Coolgardie, despite telling her she would be evicted on Wednesday.

title.children: WA government backflips on Goldfields' grandmother's pre-Christmas eviction

image.altText: A modern-looking, dark-coloured court complex.

props.synopsis: Magistrate Michelle Ridley comes down hard on Kununurra police for their dealings with a boy who she said seemed to view car theft as a form of "common entertainment".

title.children: Magistrate acquits 10-year-old who tried to ram patrol car, slams police handling of case

image.altText: A young man sits at a restaurant table, smiling and giving a thumbs up. Someone off frame has her arm around him.

props.synopsis: Construction management company Stantec pleads not guilty in a Perth court to failing to ensure the safety of apprentice Jonnie Hartshorn, who died when a glass roof collapsed at a Curtin University building site.

title.children: Company charged over death of apprentice on Curtin University site denies failings

image.altText: A portrait of a council CEO standing next to a book shelf wearing a business shirt.

props.synopsis: The Shire of Coolgardie's CEO says wants to get on with the job after the three-year investigation found no evidence of fraud, corruption or collusion with other councillors.

title.children: Outback council leader 'vindicated' after being cleared of corruption allegations

image.altText: A couple smiling holding a baby.

props.synopsis: A young couple has appeared in court charged over the death of Adelaide doctor Michael Yung after they allegedly stole from a pharmacy.

title.children: Adelaide couple allegedly stole medical items before being arrested over death of doctor Michael Yung, court told

image.altText: A woman with light brown hair looks close to tears.

props.synopsis: Angus Llewellyn is facing his second day of cross-examination by Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer, today focusing on alleged contradictory statements Brittany Higgins made during her interview on The Project.

title.children: Producer for The Project questioned about 'inconsistencies' in Brittany Higgins's interview

image.altText: Worker in high vis standing next to a tunnel boring machine.

props.synopsis: A 143-metre-long tunnel boring machine working on the massive Snowy Hydro 2.0 project is moving again, a year after getting stuck and causing a large sinkhole.

title.children: Snowy Hydro tunnel boring machine moving a year after getting stuck

image.altText: A back view of a modern flood light at a sports stadium on a dark night.

props.synopsis: Queensland's incoming premier vows to review the $2.7 billion Gabba rebuild and promises "fresh faces" in a new-look cabinet once he is confirmed.

title.children: $2.7 billion Gabba rebuild in doubt as incoming premier signals major Olympic project review

image.altText: Older man wearing a blue and grey checkered shirt standing on a farm.

props.synopsis: Arnold Dix was in Europe when he received a call about the tunnel's collapse from India's chief engineer. He was instrumental in getting all of the trapped workers out alive.

title.children: Meet the 'nerdy' Aussie farmer behind the Indian tunnel rescue that saved 41 people

image.altText: Two middle-aged women walk up the stairs of the NT Supreme Court in Darwin

props.synopsis: A mother and son duo who tried to cover-up the hit-and-run death of an Aboriginal woman by moving and burying most of her body in Darwin's rural area have been sentenced in the NT Supreme Court. The victim's leg was found on the side of the Stuart Highway last year.

title.children: Mother and son jailed for attempting to hide Indigenous woman's body following fatal hit-and-run

image.altText: Two older women with grey hair, wear bright yellow clothing and hold signs in the shape of sunflowers reading 'climate justice'

props.synopsis: The laws, passed in April 2022 after a series of climate protests, meant people could be fined $22,000 or jailed for two years for causing a major facility to be closed or if someone using the area had to be redirected.

title.children: Court rules parts of NSW protest laws are 'invalid' after challenge by Knitting Nannas activists

image.altText: A woman speaks into microphones, behind her a group of people stand solemnly

props.synopsis: The government has been facing mounting pressure to launch an inquiry following the deaths of six South Australians from alleged family and domestic violence in recent weeks.

title.children: 'It will save lives': South Australia to hold royal commission into domestic violence

image.altText: António Guterres stands reading draft text, annotated with sticky notes, surrounded by other people in suits discussing.

props.synopsis: Global leaders reach a deal to "transition away from fossil fuels" after marathon negotiations at the global climate summit COP28 finally reach a close.

title.children: Agreement reached at COP28  for 'transitioning away from fossil fuels'

image.altText: A woman wearing a black top.

props.synopsis: The NSW government has fast-tracked a development in Appin, south-west of Sydney, that it says will help address the state's housing crisis. But local residents fear they will be left stranded without infrastructure.

title.children: This little town is being rezoned to grow 13 times bigger but there's still no infrastructure plan

image.altText: A woman stands in front of several microphones and smiles as she listens

props.synopsis: Netball Australia has finally agreed to a modest revenue share partnership with its players, but how much have its brutal tactics throughout the pay negotiations damaged the game?

title.children: Netball Australia raises the white flag in long and bitter pay dispute with players

image.altText: A surfer walking out of the ocean carrying a surfboard.

props.synopsis: A one-punch attacker's barrister tells a NSW court he was "triggered" by seeing the victim, who was a convicted child sex offender, with a young woman before the fatal assault.

title.children: Court hears man who killed former pro-surfer Chris Davidson wanted to protect children

image.altText: Woman walks past house

props.synopsis: A less rosy picture of inflation in 2024, wage growth inches over the line into real pay improvements, and another tough year for renters and home buyers — here's what the government's budget update reveals about expectations for 2024.

title.children: What does the mid-year budget update tell us about the year ahead?

image.altText: Bailey Smith running at a training session

props.synopsis: Western Bulldogs star Bailey Smith is set to miss the entire 2024 AFL season after sustaining a serious knee injury at training.

title.children: Bulldogs star to miss 2024 AFL season after suffering ACL injury in training

image.altText: a clsoe up portrate of the actor

props.synopsis: American actor Andre Braugher, who starred in television series Brooklyn Nine-Nine and Homicide: Life on the Street, has died aged 61.

title.children: Andre Braugher, star of Brooklyn Nine-Nine, dies aged 61

image.altText: Andre Braugher starred as Raymond Holt for seven seasons on Brooklyn 99.

props.synopsis: Andre Braugher, the actor who brought ultra serious Captain Raymond Holt to life in long-running sitcom Brooklyn Nine-Nine, has died aged 61. We pay tribute to him through our favourite Holt moments.

title.children: Grammar obsessive, dog fan, mentor: Here are the best moments of Brooklyn Nine-Nine's Captain Raymond Holt

image.altText: purplpe building with trolly infront of fron door against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Many families doing it tough in Southern WA will go without this Christmas after thieves target Foodbank's warehouse in Bunbury.

title.children: Food off the table for families after 'boofhead' thieves target Foodbank in pre-Christmas break in

image.altText: A landscape image of Jimmy Barnes wearing a black top. The background is out of focus but there is red, orange and blue light

props.synopsis: Jane Barnes announces her husband Jimmy is recovering from open heart surgery he needed after a bacterial infection spread to his heart.

title.children: Musician Jimmy Barnes 'made it through' open heart surgery

image.altText: Trees knocked down in Port Douglas.

props.synopsis: The cyclone is expected to take several hours to fully cross the coast due to its size, with authorities warning of potentially life-threatening flash flooding. Look back on Wednesday's updates.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Jasper expected to weaken overnight, but damaging winds and heavy rainfall remain — as it happened

image.altText: An illegal fishing boat, with an Australian Border Force boat in the background

props.synopsis: Cattle and aquaculture industry leaders say the growing number of Indonesian fishing boats operating off the Kimberley is creating the risk of lumpy skin and foot and mouth disease outbreaks in Australia.

title.children: 'Almost laughable now': Fishers, farmers blast lack of enforcement on illegal fishing off northern Australia

image.altText: An Airnorth Embraer 170 jet.

props.synopsis: The airline will launch the thrice-weekly flights next year, becoming the third to announce an expansion to its network in the Northern Territory in recent months.

title.children: Regional airline Airnorth to expand service in NT with new Perth-Alice Springs flights

image.altText: A man and woman pictured from security cameras walking along Hosier Lane.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne schoolgirl says she is afraid to go out in public after a man allegedly attempted to abduct her during a school excursion last month.

title.children: 'Nothing short of heroic': Praise for bystander who stopped alleged abduction attempt in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: Barbara Woodward speaks during a meeting of the UN General Assembly.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese joins with leaders from Canada and New Zealand in a joint statement saying "this cannot be one-sided" and condemning both the October 7 Hamas attacks and the humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

title.children: World reacts to UN vote calling for ceasefire in Gaza — as it happened

image.altText: A woman with black hair looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: A fortnight after the closure of the Safe Night Space in Perth, the City of Perth and the state government are offering differing solutions.

title.children: 'Who is going to help?' Uncertainty for women seeking refuge as authorities split on solution

image.altText: Man assaulting police officer on ground

props.synopsis: Two men have been charged over the alleged assault of a police officer in Parkwood. They have also been charged with weapons offences.

title.children: Bystanders film alleged bashing of female police officer on Gold Coast, pair charged

image.altText: A luxury SUV with the text "Polizia" printed on the side and a police light on the roof

props.synopsis: Italy's state police will be driving the 666-horsepower supercar to speed up the emergency medical transport of human organs and tissues, plasma and pharmaceutical products.

title.children: Italian police unveil new Lamborghini supercar for urgent medical transports

image.altText: Sky over town of Bright, Victoria with meteors in sky

props.synopsis: Celebrate the end of the year with some fireworks of the celestial kind — this year's Geminid meteor shower could be the best Australia has seen.

title.children: No moon and great timing — just two reasons why this year's Geminid meteor shower will be a total cracker
